actions.titleHtml: University Admissions: How Will COVID-19 Affect My Application?
actions.descriptionHtml: Information sessions and tours are cancelled for prospective students. On-campuses admissions office is also closed indefinitely, although they are still answering emails and phone calls. The university has assured students whose education has been interrupted by COVID-19 that they will not be penalized in the admissions process.

actions.messageHtml: COVID-19 The University is closely monitoring the ongoing Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19) pandemic. Our top priority remains the health, safety, and well-being of our community, on and off campus. We are planning for several reopening stages to limit the spread of COVID-19 while ensuring the continuity of our teaching and research mission. We will continue to update the community regularly to keep you informed of additional measures.

actions.descriptionHtml: We're offering STEM students a $1,000 scholarship to celebrate your hard work and success. Made possible through generous donations from alumni, businesses, and other supporters.
